## custom() function

Use a custom JavaScript resolver to handle a query, mutation, or subscription.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function custom(customHandler: CustomHandlerInput): CustomHandler;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

customHandler


</td><td>

[CustomHandlerInput](./data-schema.customhandlerinput.md)


</td><td>

`{ entry: "path-to-javascript-resolver-file.js", dataSource: "Data Source name added via "backend.data.add*DataSoruce(...)"}`


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
**Returns:**

[CustomHandler](./data-schema.customhandler.md)

A JavaScript resolver attached to the query, mutation, or subscription.

## Example

const schema = a.schema(<!-- -->{ Post: a.model(<!-- -->{ content: a.string(), likes: a.integer() .authorization(allow =<!-- -->&gt; \[allow.authenticated().to(\['read'\])\]) }<!-- -->).authorization(allow =<!-- -->&gt; \[ allow.owner(), allow.authenticated().to(\['read'\]) \]),

likePost: a .mutation() .arguments(<!-- -->{ postId: a.id() }<!-- -->) .returns(a.ref('Post')) .authorization(allow =<!-- -->&gt; \[allow.authenticated()\]) .handler(a.handler.custom(<!-- -->{ dataSource: a.ref('Post'), entry: './increment-like.js' }<!-- -->)) }<!-- -->);
